Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-FamilyMemberHistory.procedure

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionProcedures that the related person had
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:code 1..1ExtensionProcedures performed on the related person
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptProcedures performed on the related person
Binding: ProcedureCodes(SNOMEDCT) (example): A code to identify a specific procedure.
extension:outcome 0..1ExtensionWhat happened following the procedure
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptWhat happened following the procedure
Binding: SNOMEDCTClinicalFindings (example): The result of the procedure; e.g. death, permanent disability, temporary disability, etc.
extension:contributedToDeath 0..1ExtensionWhether the procedure contributed to the cause of death
value[x] 0..1booleanWhether the procedure contributed to the cause of death
extension:performed[x] 0..1ExtensionWhen the procedure was performed
value[x] 0..1When the procedure was performed
valueAgeAge
valueRangeRange
valuePeriodPeriod
valueStringstring
valueDateTimedateTime
extension:note 0..*ExtensionExtra information about the procedure
value[x] 0..1AnnotationExtra information about the procedure
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-FamilyMemberHistory.procedure"

Documentation for this format

name: ext_R5_FamilyMemberHistory_procedure
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.FamilyMemberHistory.procedure for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents FamilyMemberHistory.procedure from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/FamilyMemberHistory|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Procedures that the related person had
element.definition: The significant Procedures (or procedure) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one procedure per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per procedure.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Procedures performed on the related person
element.definition: The actual procedure specified. Could be a coded procedure or a less specific string depending on how much is known about the procedure and the capabilities of the creating system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: The actual procedure specified. Could be a coded procedure or a less specific string depending on how much is known about the procedure and the capabilities of the creating system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A code to identify a specific procedure.

element.definition: Indicates what happened following the procedure. If the procedure resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

element.definition: Estimated or actual date, date-time, period, or age when the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.
